snippet: Donald J. Trump might seem an odd fit among those who prize traditional religious values, yet polls increasingly show him leading the crowded Republican field among evangelical voters.
abstract: Donald Trump, whose name is associated with luxury and who has spent most of his life pursuing wealth, has emerged as unlikely favorite among white evangelical Christian voters; extensive interviews show that evangelicals feel Trump has pure heart despite lack of overt faith, and that he is uniquely capable of leading country out of troubled times.

byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and THOMAS KAPLAN
byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti and Marina Stefan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump might seem an odd fit among those who prize traditional religious values, yet polls increasingly show him leading the crowded Republican field among evangelical voters.

headline.main: Evangelicals See Donald Trump as Man of Conviction, if Not Faith
